description: This course takes a case-study approach to the fitting and assessment of statistical
models with application to real data.  Specific topics include multiple regression, model
diagnostics, logistic regression, experimental design and ANOVA.  The approach focuses on
problem-solving tools, interpretation, model assumptions underlying analysis methods, and written
reports. Offered each semester. Prerequisite: SDS 172, ECON 260 or
(STAT 110 and SDS 164) or (AP Stat and SDS 164), or permission of instructor.
